queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason job=kube-state-metrics not reason=containercreating not reason=podinitializing  | filter _value > 0 | sum by cluster, namespace, container,reason

cluster={{cluster}} metric=kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason job=kube-state-metrics not reason=containercreating not reason=podinitializing  | filter _value > 0 | sum by cluster, namespace, reason

panels.title: Waiting or Pending Pods
panels.text: If a Pod is stuck in the Waiting state, then it has been scheduled to a worker node, but it can't run on that machine. Again, the information from kubectl describe ... should be informative. The most common cause of Waiting pods is a failure to pull the image.

panels.title: DaemonSet Misscheduled
panels.text: A number of pods of daemonset are running where they are not supposed to run. [runbook](https://runbooks.prometheus-operator.dev/runbooks/kubernetes/kubedaemonsetmisscheduled/)

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_daemonset_status_number_misscheduled job=kube-state-metrics | filter _value > 0 | sum by cluster

panels.title: DaemonSet Not Scheduled
panels.text: A number of pods of daemonset are not scheduled. [runbook](https://runbooks.prometheus-operator.dev/runbooks/kubernetes/kubedaemonsetnotscheduled/)

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_daemonset_status_desired_number_scheduled job=kube-state-metrics | quantize to 5m using max
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_daemonset_status_current_number_scheduled job=kube-state-metrics | quantize to 5m using max
#A - #B along daemonset, cluster  | where _value > 0

panels.title: Kube API Server Instance Count
panels.text: KubeAPI node count should be consistent in Prometheus. If instances are not discoverable scaling may be in progress or nodes down.

panels.title: Kube API Server Instance Count - Unexpected Drop Indicates API Server is Down

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=up job=apiserver  | quantize to 15m using max | sum by cluster,instance | avg by cluster

panels.title: Nodes Ready State
panels.text: Kubernetes runs your workload by placing containers into Pods to run on Nodes. The conditions field describes the status of all Running nodes [conditions](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/architecture/nodes/#node-status)

panels.title: kube-state-metrics Clusters With Nodes Not Ready

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_node_status_condition job=kube-state-metrics not condition=ready  status=true | quantize to 15m using max | filter max > 0 | max by cluster,condition,node | sum by cluster,condition
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_node_status_condition job=kube-state-metrics  condition=ready  status=true | quantize to 15m using max | max by cluster,node | sum by cluster

panels.title: Pods Terminating With Undesired States Such as OOMKilled

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_container_status_terminated_reason not reason=completed | filter _value > 0| quantize to 15m using max | filter max > 0 | max by cluster,reason,pod | sum by cluster,reason

panels.title: Containers Waiting
panels.text: This panel will show where you have CrashLoopBackoff occuring

panels.title: Clusters With Nodes Not Condition Ready

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason not reason=containercreating not reason=podinitializing | quantize to 15m using max | sum by cluster,namespace,reason
cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_container_status_waiting_reason not reason=containercreating not reason=podinitializing | filter _value >0| max by container,reason

_sourcecategory=*kubelet*  cluster={{cluster}} 
(
CrashLoopBackOff
or
OOMKilled
or
(Error syncing pod) 
or (reason evicted) 
or ("Failed to pull image") 
or Failedattachvolume
or FailedattachMount
or FailedScheduling
or "MountVolume.SetUp failed"
or (configmap "not found") 
or (secret "not found") 
or NodeNotReady 
or HostPortConflict 
or "Failed to pull image"
or ( (error failed) not "when try to find container")
)
| json field=_raw "_HOSTNAME" as hostname
| json field=_raw "MESSAGE" | where message matches "E*" 
// key indicators
| parse regex field=message "(?i)(?<keyindicator>oomkilled|crashloopbackoff)" nodrop
| parse regex field=message "^(?<level>[A-Z])+[0-9]+\s+[0-9:\.]+\s+(?<threadid>[0-9]+)\s+(?<file>[^\s:]+):(?<lineno>[0-9]+)\]\s(?<event>.+)" nodrop
| parse regex field=event "(?i)(?<type>Error syncing pod|oomkilled|CrashLoopBackOff|evicted|Failedattachvolume|FailedattachMount|FailedScheduling|Error: [^\s]+ failed|configmap .+not found$|secret .+not found$|NodeNotReady|HostPortConflict|Failed to pull image)" nodrop 

// strict
| where !(isempty(type))

// wider
//| if(isempty(type),concat("others:",substring(event,0,50)),type) as type
| parse field=event "\"StartContainer\" for \"*\" with" as container nodrop
| trim(concat(type," ",keyindicator," ",container)) as type

//|  min(_messagetime) as starttime,max(_messagetime) as endtime,first(event) as example ,count by cluster,file,type,hostname 
| first(event) as example,values(hostname) as hosts,count as errors by cluster,file,type
| sort type asc
//| sum(_count) by type

panels.title: Kubelet Events
panels.text: Well known error kubernetes events in Kubelet logs

queries.queryString:
_sourcecategory=*kubelet*   cluster={{cluster}} 
(
CrashLoopBackOff
or
OOMKilled
or
(Error syncing pod) 
or (reason evicted) 
or ("Failed to pull image") 
or Failedattachvolume
or FailedattachMount
or FailedScheduling
or "MountVolume.SetUp failed"
or (configmap "not found") 
or (secret "not found") 
or NodeNotReady 
or HostPortConflict 
or "Failed to pull image"
or ( (error failed) not "when try to find container")
)
| json field=_raw "_HOSTNAME" as hostname
| json field=_raw "MESSAGE" | where message matches "E*" 
// key indicators
| parse regex field=message "(?i)(?<keyindicator>oomkilled|crashloopbackoff)" nodrop
| parse regex field=message "^(?<level>[A-Z])+[0-9]+\s+[0-9:\.]+\s+(?<threadid>[0-9]+)\s+(?<file>[^\s:]+):(?<lineno>[0-9]+)\]\s(?<event>.+)" nodrop
| parse regex field=event "(?i)(?<type>Error syncing pod|oomkilled|CrashLoopBackOff|evicted|Failedattachvolume|FailedattachMount|FailedScheduling|Error: [^\s]+ failed|configmap .+not found$|secret .+not found$|NodeNotReady|HostPortConflict|Failed to pull image)" nodrop 

// strict
| where !(isempty(type))

// wider
//| if(isempty(type),concat("others:",substring(event,0,50)),type) as type

| trim(concat(type," ",keyindicator)) as type
//|  min(_messagetime) as starttime,max(_messagetime) as endtime,first(event) as example ,count by cluster,file,type,hostname 
//| first(event) as example,values(hostname) as hosts,count as errors by cluster,file,type
| sort type asc
| count as errors by type | sort errors

panels.title: Kubelet Common Error Conditions By Type

queries.queryString:
_sourcecategory=*kubelet*  cluster={{cluster}} 
(
CrashLoopBackOff
or
OOMKilled
or
(Error syncing pod) 
or (reason evicted) 
or ("Failed to pull image") 
or Failedattachvolume
or FailedattachMount
or FailedScheduling
or "MountVolume.SetUp failed"
or (configmap "not found") 
or (secret "not found") 
or NodeNotReady 
or HostPortConflict 
or "Failed to pull image"
or ( (error failed) not "when try to find container")
)
| json field=_raw "_HOSTNAME" as hostname
| json field=_raw "MESSAGE" | where message matches "E*" 
// key indicators
| parse regex field=message "(?i)(?<keyindicator>oomkilled|crashloopbackoff)" nodrop
| parse regex field=message "^(?<level>[A-Z])+[0-9]+\s+[0-9:\.]+\s+(?<threadid>[0-9]+)\s+(?<file>[^\s:]+):(?<lineno>[0-9]+)\]\s(?<event>.+)" nodrop
| parse regex field=event "(?i)(?<type>Error syncing pod|oomkilled|CrashLoopBackOff|evicted|Failedattachvolume|FailedattachMount|FailedScheduling|Error: [^\s]+ failed|configmap .+not found$|secret .+not found$|NodeNotReady|HostPortConflict|Failed to pull image)" nodrop 

// strict
| where !(isempty(type))

// wider
//| if(isempty(type),concat("others:",substring(event,0,50)),type) as type

| trim(concat(type," ",keyindicator)) as type
//|  min(_messagetime) as starttime,max(_messagetime) as endtime,first(event) as example ,count by cluster,file,type,hostname 
//| first(event) as example,values(hostname) as hosts,count as errors by cluster,file,type
| timeslice 1h | count by _timeslice,type | transpose row _timeslice column type

panels.title: Kubelet Common Error Conditions By Cluster

queries.queryString:
_sourcecategory=*kubelet*  cluster={{cluster}} 
(
CrashLoopBackOff
or
OOMKilled
or
(Error syncing pod) 
or (reason evicted) 
or ("Failed to pull image") 
or Failedattachvolume
or FailedattachMount
or FailedScheduling
or "MountVolume.SetUp failed"
or (configmap "not found") 
or (secret "not found") 
or NodeNotReady 
or HostPortConflict 
or "Failed to pull image"
or ( (error failed) not "when try to find container")
)
| json field=_raw "_HOSTNAME" as hostname
| json field=_raw "MESSAGE" | where message matches "E*" 
// key indicators
| parse regex field=message "(?i)(?<keyindicator>oomkilled|crashloopbackoff)" nodrop
| parse regex field=message "^(?<level>[A-Z])+[0-9]+\s+[0-9:\.]+\s+(?<threadid>[0-9]+)\s+(?<file>[^\s:]+):(?<lineno>[0-9]+)\]\s(?<event>.+)" nodrop
| parse regex field=event "(?i)(?<type>Error syncing pod|oomkilled|CrashLoopBackOff|evicted|Failedattachvolume|FailedattachMount|FailedScheduling|Error: [^\s]+ failed|configmap .+not found$|secret .+not found$|NodeNotReady|HostPortConflict|Failed to pull image)" nodrop 

// strict
| where !(isempty(type))

// wider
//| if(isempty(type),concat("others:",substring(event,0,50)),type) as type

| trim(concat(type," ",keyindicator)) as type
//|  min(_messagetime) as starttime,max(_messagetime) as endtime,first(event) as example ,count by cluster,file,type,hostname 
//| first(event) as example,values(hostname) as hosts,count as errors by cluster,file,type
| hostname as node
| timeslice 1h | count by _timeslice,cluster | transpose row _timeslice column cluster

panels.title: Containers Frequently Restarting
panels.text: metric=kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total is a cumulative restart count so from this we can look for containers with high restart count (or possibly crash loops etc)

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_container_status_restarts_total job=kube-state-metrics | filter _value >0 | quantize to 5m using max | delta increasing   | sum by namespace,container

panels.title: Pod Phase: pending, unknown or failed

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_status_phase (phase=pending or phase=unknown or phase=failed) | filter _value > 0 | sum by cluster, namespace, phase

panels.title: Pod Phase: pending, unknown or failed - Details

queries.queryString: cluster={{cluster}}  metric=kube_pod_status_phase (phase=pending or phase=unknown or phase=failed) | quantize to 5m using max | filter _value > 0 | sum by cluster, namespace, phase, pod, container

panels.title: Pods That Cannot Be Scheduled
panels.text:
If the pod is requesting more resources than any node can provide, it will not be scheduled. This can be solved by adding nodes, increasing node size, or reducing the resource requests of pods.
Taints and tolerations work together to ensure that pods are not scheduled onto inappropriate nodes. One or more taints are applied to a node; this marks that the node should not accept any pods that do not tolerate the taints.

queries.queryString:
cluster={{cluster}}  _sourceCategory=*events 
not "\"type\":\"Normal\""
// exclude any annoying messages here
involvedObject
not "Nameserver limits were exceeded"
not "Liveness probe failed"
| json field=_raw "object.reason" as reason
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.kind" as type
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.name" as name
| json field=_raw "object.type" as level
| json field=_raw "object.message" as message
| json field=_raw "object.metadata.namespace" as namespace


| count by cluster,reason,type,level,namespace,name,message
| sort _count

metric=kube_pod_status_phase (phase=pending or phase=unknown or phase=failed) cluster={{cluster}} | where _value > 0
|  sum by cluster, pod

panels.title: Resource Overview 'Top Lists' Use top_n
panels.text: Well known error kubernetes events in Kubelet logs

queries.queryString:
metric=node_cpu_seconds_total cluster={{cluster}} not mode=idle 
| quantize using max
| delta counter
//| where max > 100
| topk(50, max) 
| sum by pod //| where _value > 800
metric=node_memory_MemTotal_bytes  cluster={{cluster}}  | avg by cluster, node
metric=container_memory_working_set_bytes cluster={{cluster}} node=* | sum by cluster, node | avg by cluster, node

cluster={{cluster}} _sourceCategory=*events  *node*
// not "\"type\":\"Normal\""
// exclude any annoying messages here
involvedObject
//node scal*
not "Nameserver limits were exceeded"
not "Liveness probe failed"
not FailedAttachVolume
not *hassufficient*
not *NodeHasNo*
not "Node is not ready"
| json field=_raw "object.reason" as reason
| json field=_raw "object.message" as message
| where reason matches /(?i)node|scal/  or message matches /(?i)node[ \.]/
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.kind" as type
| json field=_raw "object.involvedObject.name" as name
| json field=_raw "object.type" as level

| json field=_raw "object.metadata.namespace" as namespace

| timeslice 
| count as events,min(_messagetime) as first, max(_messagetime) as last by cluster,reason,type,level,namespace,name,message
| sort last | formatdate(tolong(last),"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss") as last| formatdate(tolong(first),"yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss") as first

panels.title: Memory Usage vs Limits - Top 50 Per container/pod/cluster/node

queries.queryString:
metric=kube_pod_container_resource_limits resource=memory cluster=* pod=* node=*
| quantize 5m using max 
 | avg by cluster, node, pod , container

metric=container_memory_working_set_bytes cluster=* pod=* node=*
| quantize 5m using avg 
| max by cluster, node, pod ,container
((#B/#A) * 100) along cluster, node, pod , container| quantize 5m | topk({{top_n}},max)

panels.title: CPU Usage Top by Node, Cluster

queries.queryString:
metric=node_cpu_seconds_total cluster={{cluster}} not mode=idle 
| quantize using max
| delta counter
//| where max > 100
| topk({{top_n}}, max) 
| sum by node,cluster //| where _value > 800
